author: JoeUX
body:
After installing Powershell 7.0.2, there is no longer an app icon in the Taskbar. Instead, there is a white rectangle, the standard placeholder icon. This is confirmed on two Windows 10 Pro machines. Screenshot below, followed by environment data.

Screenshot. See the white rectangle next to the VS Code icon in the center. That's Powershell 7.0.2:

![Powershell No Icon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8071692/84898609-666b2880-b05c-11ea-9774-d236dda2fbaf.JPG)


## Environment data

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It is dup #11995.
It was fixed in #12792 but not backported.
Perhaps @TravisEz13 can add more info.

comments.author: JoeUX
comments.body: Oh dang, I didn't see that one when I searched. 7.0.2 was just released – I wonder why it's not in it.

comments.author: TravisEz13
msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as duplicate and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: No Taskbar icon with Powershell 7.0.2
